item.title: 泰森食品公司被保守派团体指控雇用移民多于美国公民
item.description: 由前特朗普政府官员成立的一个组织周三指责泰森食品公司歧视美国公民，过多地雇用移民，包括儿童和非法入境者。【原文：A group founded by former Trump administration officials accused Tyson Foods on Wednesday of discriminating against U.S. citizens by disproportionately hiring immigrants, including children and people in the country illegally.】

item.title: 波音公司称在 737 MAX 防冰发动机问题上取得进展
item.description: 波音公司周三表示，正在制定永久性解决方案，以解决737 MAX防冰系统可能过热并导致发动机故障的问题。【原文：Boeing said Wednesday it is making progress on developing a permanent solution to address an issue with the 737 MAX anti-ice system that can overheat and could cause an engine failure.】

item.title: 美国之鹰公司季度收入不及预期
item.description: 美国鹰服装公司（American Eagle Outfitters）周三的季度收入未能达到华尔街的预期，原因是持续的通货膨胀损害了消费者对通常以全价出售的服装和配饰的需求。【原文：American Eagle Outfitters on Wednesday missed Wall Street estimates for quarterly revenue as sticky inflation hurt consumer demand for its apparel and accessories often sold at full price.】

item.title: 惠普个人电脑需求复苏，营收超出预期
item.description: 惠普公司周三公布的第二季度营收超出华尔街预期，表明随着客户升级系统，个人电脑（PC）市场正在复苏。【原文：HP Inc beat Wall Street estimates for second-quarter revenue on Wednesday, signaling a recovery in the personal computer (PC) market as customers upgrade their systems.】

item.title: 麦当劳美国高层谴责关于价格飞涨的病毒式报道
item.description: 自 2019 年以来，麦当劳的利润激增了约三分之一，目前正准备推出 5 美元套餐。【原文：McDonald's top U.S. executive denounced viral reports of runaway Big Mac prices as painting an inaccurate picture of the company, which has seen its profits surge by roughly a third since 2019 and is now preparing to roll out $5 combo meals.】

item.title: Salesforce 预测第二季度营收低于预期
item.description: 周三，Salesforce 预测第二季度营收低于华尔街预期，原因是在经济不确定的情况下，云计算和企业业务产品的客户支出疲软，导致其股价在盘后交易中下跌 9%。【原文：Salesforce forecast second-quarter revenue below Wall Street expectations on Wednesday, on weak client spending on its cloud and enterprise business products in an uncertain economy, sending its shares down 9% in extended trading.】

item.title: CNBC 报道：马斯克 560 亿美元薪酬方案遭 CalPERS 首席执行官反对
item.description: 据 CNBC 周三报道，加州公务员退休系统（CalPERS）首席执行官玛西-弗罗斯特（Marcie Frost）正计划反对特斯拉首席执行官埃隆-马斯克 560 亿美元的薪酬方案。【原文：The California Public Employees Retirement System (CalPERS) CEO Marcie Frost is planning to oppose Tesla CEO Elon Musk's $56 billion pay package, CNBC reported on Wednesday.】

item.title: 威士公司和万事达公司将支付 1.97 亿美元解决消费者 ATM 收费诉讼
item.description: 威士（Visa）和万事达（Mastercard）已同意支付 1.97 亿美元，以解决数百万消费者提出的集体诉讼，这些消费者指控这两家金融支付公司人为地将现金存取费维持在高水平。【原文：Visa and Mastercard have agreed to pay $197 million to resolve a class action by millions of consumers accusing the financial payment companies of keeping cash access fees artificially high.】

item.title: 美联储调查显示，美国企业对经济前景愈发悲观
item.description: 美国联邦储备委员会（U.S. Federal Reserve）周三的一项调查显示，从4月初到5月中旬，美国经济活动继续扩张，但企业对未来的悲观情绪有所增加，同时通胀率小幅上升。【原文：U.S. economic activity continued to expand from early April through mid-May but firms grew more pessimistic about the future while inflation increased at a modest pace, a U.S. Federal Reserve survey showed on Wednesday, as central bankers mull how long they will need to keep interest rates at current levels.】

item.title: 美国医疗保险公司股价在 UnitedHealth 公布医疗补助注册问题后下跌
item.description: 美国联合健康集团（UnitedHealth Group）称，由于大约一年前开始的医疗补助（Medicaid）项目在整个项目范围内的持续注册障碍，医疗补助的报销率在短期内会受到干扰，美国医疗保险公司的股票在周三下跌。【原文：Shares of U.S. health insurers fell on Wednesday after UnitedHealth Group cited a near-term disturbance around reimbursement rates for Medicaid due to ongoing program-wide enrollment hurdles that began about a year ago.】

item.title: 消息人士称，美国联邦航空局局长周四将就质量计划与波音公司首席执行官会面
item.description: 消息人士告诉路透社，美国联邦航空管理局局长将于周四与波音公司首席执行官戴夫-卡尔霍恩（Dave Calhoun）和公司其他高级官员会面，讨论公司的质量改进计划。【原文：The head of the Federal Aviation Administration is set to meet on Thursday with Boeing CEO Dave Calhoun and other senior company officials on the company's quality improvement plans, sources told Reuters.】

item.title: 美国要求特斯拉提供动力转向损失调查记录
item.description: 美国国家公路交通安全管理局（National Highway Traffic Safety Administration）周三表示，在对 Model 3 和 Model Y 汽车动力转向损失的调查中，正在向特斯拉索取相关记录。【原文：The National Highway Traffic Safety Administration on Wednesday said it is seeking records from Tesla in its investigation into Model 3 and Model Y vehicles over power steering loss.】

item.title: 阿姆斯特丹史基浦机场有人在飞机引擎中丧生
item.description: 荷兰皇家航空公司（KLM）周三表示，在阿姆斯特丹史基浦机场，一名乘客因被卷入正在运转的飞机引擎而死亡。【原文：A person died after ending up in a running aircraft engine at Amsterdam's Schiphol airport, Dutch airline KLM said on Wednesday.】

item.title: 巴西 Azul 航空公司预计与 Gol 航空公司的代码共享交易不会遇到反垄断障碍
item.description: Azul 航空公司首席执行官告诉路透社，巴西 Azul 航空公司和 Gol 航空公司已向当地反垄断监管机构 CADE 通报了新的代码共享协议，预计不会设置障碍。【原文：Brazilian airlines Azul and Gol have informed local antitrust regulator CADE of their new codeshare agreement and do not expect hurdles to be imposed, Azul's chief executive told Reuters.】

item.title: 雪佛龙股东重新选举所有董事，首席执行官对赫斯交易充满信心
item.description: 雪佛龙股东周三投票重新选举了董事会的全部 12 名现任董事，以示对这家石油巨头的支持。【原文：Chevron shareholders on Wednesday voted to re-elect all 12 sitting directors to its board, in a sign of support for the oil major.】

item.title: Meta 识别出推送可能由人工智能生成的欺骗性内容的网络
item.description: Meta 公司周三表示，它在其 Facebook 和 Instagram 平台上发现了 "很可能是人工智能生成的 "欺骗性内容，包括在全球新闻机构和美国立法者的帖子下面发表赞扬以色列处理加沙战争的评论。【原文：Meta said on Wednesday it had found "likely AI-generated" content used deceptively on its Facebook and Instagram platforms, including comments praising Israel's handling of the war in Gaza published below posts from global news organizations and U.S. lawmakers.】

item.title: Nexi、Stripe和Adyen在意大利推出苹果 "点击支付 "服务
item.description: 支付公司 Nexi、Stripe 和 Adyen 周三表示，它们已开始为意大利的企业提供一种依靠苹果 iPhone 接受客户付款的方式。【原文：Payments companies Nexi , Stripe and Adyen have started offering businesses in Italy a way to accept payments from customers that relies on Apple's iPhones, they said on Wednesday.】

item.title: 必和必拓放弃对英美资源集团提出的 490 亿美元收购要约
item.description: 必和必拓集团周三表示，在英美资源集团拒绝延长竞购期限后，该公司不打算对英美资源集团提出正式收购要约，从而放弃了价值490亿美元的收购交易。【原文：BHP Group said on Wednesday it did not intend to make a formal offer for Anglo American , walking away from its $49 billion takeover deal, after the London-listed rival refused to extend the bid deadline.】

item.title: 美国航空公司因将黑人乘客赶下飞机而被起诉
item.description: 美国航空公司周三在一起诉讼中被指控种族歧视，因为该公司将三名黑人男子从亚利桑那州凤凰城飞往纽约的航班上临时赶下飞机。【原文：American Airlines was accused in a lawsuit on Wednesday of race discrimination for temporarily removing three Black men from a flight from Phoenix, Arizona, to New York City.】

item.title: OpenAI 与《大西洋月刊》和 Vox Media 签订内容协议
item.description: Sam Altman 领导的 OpenAI 周三表示，它已与《大西洋月刊》和 Vox Media 签订了内容和产品合作协议。【原文：Sam Altman-led OpenAI said on Wednesday it has signed content and product partnerships with the Atlantic and Vox Media.】

item.title: 高盛为直接借贷融资 200 多亿美元
item.description: 高盛资产管理公司（Goldman Sachs Asset Management）的另类投资平台周三表示，其最新基金已为高级直接借贷筹集了 200 多亿美元。【原文：Goldman Sachs Asset Management's alternative investments platform said on Wednesday its latest fund had raised more than $20 billion for senior direct lending.】

item.title: Arm 为智能手机上的人工智能提供全新设计和软件
item.description: Arm Holdings 公司周三发布了新的芯片蓝图和软件工具，以帮助智能手机处理人工智能任务，同时还改变了提供这些蓝图的方式，从而有助于加快它们的应用。【原文：Arm Holdings on Wednesday unveiled new chip blueprints and software tools to help smartphones handle artificial intelligence tasks, along with changes to how it delivers those blueprints that could help speed their adoption.】

item.title: 双子星客户从创世公司破产中拿回 20 多亿美元加密货币
item.description: 破产的加密贷款公司创世（Genesis）和加密货币交易所双子星（Gemini）周三表示，在他们共同管理的双子星盈利（Gemini Earn）计划中，已向23.2万名零售客户返还了超过20亿美元的加密货币，使客户自2023年1月以来锁定的资产获得了242%的回报。【原文：Bankrupt crypto lender Genesis and crypto exchange Gemini have returned over $2 billion in crypto to 232,000 retail customers in their jointly managed Gemini Earn program, giving customers a 242% return on assets locked up since January 2023, Gemini said on Wednesday.】

item.title: 金融市场协会对贸易结算速度加快表示满意
item.description: 证券业和金融市场协会（Sifma）周三表示，它对向更快的交易结算过渡感到高兴，并补充说它将继续监测进展情况。【原文：The Securities Industry and Financial Markets Association (Sifma) said on Wednesday it is pleased with the transition to faster trade settlement, adding it continues to monitor progress.】

item.title: 空乘人员工会就边疆航空公司的运营改革寻求联邦调解
item.description: 代表边疆航空公司（Frontier Airlines）约 4100 名空乘人员的工会周三就该公司的运营改革计划申请联邦调解。【原文：A union representing about 4,100 flight attendants at Frontier Airlines on Wednesday filed for federal mediation over the carrier's plan to overhaul its operations.】

item.title: 摩根大通戴蒙表示将 "做正确的事 "接班，并反击首席执行官与董事长分裂的说法
item.description: 摩根大通首席执行官杰米-戴蒙（Jamie Dimon）周三表示，银行董事长和首席执行官角色的分工被夸大了，同时他还补充说，他和董事会将在接班人问题上做出正确的决定。【原文：JPMorgan Chase CEO Jamie Dimon said on Wednesday that the split between chairman and CEO roles in the bank are overstated while adding that he and the board will do the right thing on succession.】

item.title: 富国银行首席执行官称企业业务和交易受制于资产上限
item.description: 富国银行首席执行官查理-沙尔夫（Charlie Scharf）周三表示，监管机构对该银行规定的资产上限限制了其吸收更多企业存款和扩大交易业务的能力。【原文：Wells Fargo CEO Charlie Scharf said on Wednesday that the asset cap imposed on the bank by regulators is curtailing its ability to take in more corporate deposits and expand its trading business.】

item.title: 大公司摆脱倒闭银行成本，美国银行利润猛增 79.5
item.description: 2024 年第一季度，美国银行业的利润激增 79.5%，达到 642 亿美元，这主要是由于大型银行无需承担为收回去年春季银行倒闭造成的成本而被要求支付的数十亿美元特别费用。【原文：Profits for the U.S. banking sector surged 79.5% to $64.2 billion in the first quarter of 2024, boosted primarily by large banks not shouldering billions in special fees they were directed to pay to recover costs incurred by bank failures last spring.】

item.title: 电子产品消费疲软，百思买销售额将连续第十个季度下滑
item.description: 本周四，美国电子产品零售商百思买（Best Buy）将公布季度业绩，销售额将连续第十个季度下滑。【原文：Best Buy is set to post its tenth consecutive quarter of sales decline on Thursday when the U.S. electronics retailer reports quarterly results, as spending on big-ticket electronics remains pressured despite easing inflation.】

item.title: 消息人士称，汽车电池制造商将在下周举行的听证会上对抗欧盟卡特尔指控
item.description: 据直接知情人士周三透露，在下周举行的非公开听证会上，一批汽车起动机电池制造商将对欧盟关于卡特尔操纵电池价格的指控提出质疑。【原文：A group of car starter battery makers will contest European Union accusations of operating a cartel to fix battery prices at a closed hearing next week, people with direct knowledge of the matter said on Wednesday.】
